question.long: Does red meat consumption increase the risk of developing cancer?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of red meat consumption on the risk of developing cancer.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of red meat on cancer

no.description: The literature suggests that red meat does not cause cancer

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that red meat probably doesn't cause cancer, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that red meat may cause cancer, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that red meat causes cancer

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the red meat evaluated on the risk of developing cancer

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the red meat evaluated on the risk of developing cancer, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of the red meat evaluated on the risk of developing cancer, but there are mixed results on specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that the red meat evaluated might have an effect on the risk of developing cancer, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that the red meat evaluated may increase the risk of developing cancer, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that the red meat evaluated may have a small effect on the risk of developing cancer

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the red meat evaluated may increase the risk of developing cancer, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that the red meat evaluated increases the risk of developing cancer
